data.求人内容:
[Laboratory]
Laboratory for Marmoset Neural Architecture （Laboratory Head：Hideyuki Okano）

[Research Field]
The Marmoset Brain Architecture Project, a collaborative effort between professors Partha P Mitra (CSHL) and Hideyuki Okano (Riken BSI) aims to obtain a mesoscale connectivity map of the whole marmoset brain, using methods that have been previously successfully applied in the mouse http://mouse.brainarchitecture.org. This ambitious project will be the first time such a comprehensive mapping attempt has been made for a primate brain, using tracer injections placed on a systematic grid, followed by histological processing and digital imaging of the entire brain at light microscope resolution. The data set will be subjected to computational neuroanatomical analysis.

[Job title and Job description]
1 Research Scientist (Lab Manager)

The Laboratory Manager/Research Scientist for this project will be responsible for the experimental component of the project, managing a team of laboratory technicians and also being involved hands-on in the day to day operations of the high throughput anatomical pipeline. Although not an independent research position, the applicant is expected to have the scientific and professional maturity to deal with both scientific and technical issues that may arise in the project, with supervisory input from Dr Mitra and in coordination with his laboratory. Ideally the applicant will have some training in primate neuroanatomy (or a related subject) and also have technological skills required to run a semi-automated tissue processing pipeline. The successful candidate will undergo a brief period of further training in preparation for the project in Dr Mitra's laboratory.

[Work location]
RIKEN Brain Science Institute (2-1 Hirosawa, Wako, Saitama, Japan) is located in greater Tokyo area, about 30 min from the center of the city by train.

[Start of Employment]
Negotiable
